snippet: As the battle for the Syrian capital worsened, a Turkish official said that Russia had agreed to try a new approach to persuade President Bashar al-Assad to relinquish power.
abstract: Fierce fighting and setbacks on diplomatic front increase pressure on Syria's embattled government as fresh signs emerge of worsening battle for control of capital Damascus; Russia agrees to try new diplomatic approach to persuade Pres Bashar al-Assad to relinquish power, sign of possible weakening in its steadfast support for Syria's government.

byline.original: By ANNE BARNARD and ELLEN BARRY
byline.contributor: Anne Barnard reported from Beirut, Lebanon, and Ellen Barry from Moscow. Reporting was contributed by Sebnem Arsu in Istanbul, Peter Baker in Washington, Hwaida Saad, Neil MacFarquhar and Hania Mourtada in Beirut and Christine Hauser in New York.

lead_paragraph: As the battle for the Syrian capital worsened, a Turkish official said that Russia had agreed to try a new approach to persuade President Bashar al-Assad to relinquish power.

headline.seo: Syrian Government Beset by Battles and Diplomatic Setbacks
headline.main: Assad Suffering Reversals in Fighting and Diplomacy
headline.print_headline: Assad Suffering Reversals In Fighting and Diplomacy
